derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: past participle of the rare verb anguish, from Old French anguissier, from ecclesiastical Latin angustiare 'to distress', from Latin angustia (see anguish)

entry.def: Anguished means showing or feeling great mental suffering or physical pain.

example.ex: She let out an anguished cry.

means.word_mean: 1. experiencing intense pain especially mental pain;
